'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}} and {{lse|GGEA}}) is an [[United States|American]] [[public company|public corporation]], specializing in [[Internet search]] and [[online advertising]]. The company is based in [[Mountain View, California]], and has 15,916 full-time employees (as of [[September 30]] [[2007]]).<ref name=q32007results /> It is the largest American company (by [[market capitalization]]) that is not part of the [[Dow Jones Industrial Average]]. <ref>http://bigpicture.typepad.com/comments/2007/11/google-5-us-mar.html</ref>
+
'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}} and {{lse|GGEA}}) is an [[United States|American]] [[public company|public corporation]], specializing in [[Internet search]] and [[online advertising]]. The company is based in [[Mountain View, California]], and has 15,916 full-time employees (as of [[September 30]] [[2007]]).<ref name=q32007results /> It is the largest American company (by [[market capitalization]]) that is not part of the [[Dow Jones Industrial Average]]. <ref>{{cite web
  +
|url=http://blogs.wsj.com/marketbeat/2007/10/31/googles-surge-would-make-casey-kasem-proud/
  +
|title=Googleâs Surge Would Make Casey Kasem Proud
  +
|publisher=Wall Street Journal
  +
|accessdate=2008-01-21}}</ref>
Google was co-founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while they were students at [[Stanford University]] and the company was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on [[September 7]], [[1998]]. Google's [[initial public offering]] took place on [[August 19]], [[2004]], raising [[United States dollar|US$]]1.67 billion, making it worth US$23 billion. Through a series of new product developments, acquisitions and partnerships, the company has expanded its initial [[google search|search]] and [[AdWords|advertising]] business into other areas, including [[Gmail|web-based e-mail]], [[Google Earth|online mapping]], [[Google Docs|office productivity]], and [[YouTube|video sharing]], among others.
Google was co-founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while they were students at [[Stanford University]] and the company was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on [[September 7]], [[1998]]. Google's [[initial public offering]] took place on [[August 19]], [[2004]], raising [[United States dollar|US$]]1.67 billion, making it worth US$23 billion. Through a series of new product developments, acquisitions and partnerships, the company has expanded its initial [[google search|search]] and [[AdWords|advertising]] business into other areas, including [[Gmail|web-based e-mail]], [[Google Earth|online mapping]], [[Google Docs|office productivity]], and [[YouTube|video sharing]], among others.
